Three days later the PC started doing the same thing. The PC turned off then powered on then turned off. Now the PC will not power on. I followed a lot the steps that the provided for troubleshooting when I was able to get someone. That took a week. Now no one is responding and the PC will not power on. I have been reaching out to Cycberpower for over 3 weeks now and no response. Dont buy from this company. Waste of money and the company does not honor there word.

When I got it back the problem I had with black screen still wasn't fixed and I ended up having to turn my sleep/screensaver settings off completely to get it to work. Then today it just started shutting itself off, no blue screen no nothing. I called and was told I need a new cpu fan which they will send out. I am yet again inconvenienced by a pc I've had for less than 9 months and I will never buy a pc from them again.

There's way to much to go over but to sum it up it's a great PC for it's price range (in my opinion) but as you use it and start to see it's limits you also start to see why it's only $500 and not $1000 or higher. A few complaints I want you to know that I have that you may have are the light's they are annoying especially during the night because the keyboard stays on and the mouse stays glowing off and on when the computers on and sometimes in early stand by stages. The next is the noise it makes when it turns on and when the CPU is being pushed or used extensively. Well it actually makes constant noise regardless of what your doing but at those times it gets worse. The last is not to long after I got it the CPU fan broke and my computer would overheat without it but I called CyberpowerPC and they resovled my issue even though it took half an hour or longer. After the call I got my new FREE CPU fan in like 3 to 5 days.

I purchased my computer in October of 2016, and for these last few months it's performed stunningly and ran most any game smoothly with little to no trouble, however I'm disappointed to find out that only 6 months later my cooling fan is already going out. Games that would usually run without any effort were now overheating my computer and causing it to shut down, and to be honest I don't really game heavy. I contacted customer support, and the assistant was quite nice and instructed me to first attempt cleaning any dust from the fans and inside of my PC as they can cause overheating and if it didn't improve things to contact them again. I'd asked a more computer savvy friend after this didn't work (while the fan did run quieter after the dusting) and he announced that unfortunately my fan was going out. I'm very bummed out that things would start breaking down only 6 months in, I had been very satisfied otherwise. My satisfaction from here in will depend on how their customer service plans on handling the problem when I contact them in the morning. Until then my rating stands at 3 but I will update my review once I've spoken to them.

** Update 1: After 55 minutes in queue on the phone I finally was able to speak to a customer service rep who was nice and helpful enough though not quite enough to make up for the ridiculous amount of time spent trying to get a hold of him. Either way, he was quick to help me order a new fan for arrival in 4-5 business days. I don't want to say the customer service was poor because the rep himself was quite helpful, but either they were stacked with calls or he was the only one in the office because almost an hour of wait time for the 3 minutes of actual talking to a rep is insane.

**Update 2: So, it's been about two weeks, the part was on back order but customer service was VERY helpful and called me to give me updates up until the part finally shipped. Part shipped on Tuesday and got here the following Monday, fan was installed and so far running smoothly and no signs of overheating while gaming. Fingers crossed it stays that way. All in all for the excellent customer service experience and satisfaction for the project I'll change my 3 to a 4. Not a 5 only because I'm still a little disappointed that the fan died so fast in the first place.

**Update 3: It's been about 4-5 months since my last update. I did receive the fan and everything has been smooth sailing until a few days ago and I noticed that once again, the fan has started to crap out. Seems this is going to be a reoccurring problem. I may have to be forced to spend more money to upgrade.

So this is the first pc I have ever owned and was a learning experience for me. Since getting this pc in august, Ive gone from complete noobie to outsmarting some of my friends. Here is a very basic guide for any newbies out there who need that extra guidance...much like I did back in august.

First of all, this computer IS a good starter computer. For the price, you can't get much better. HOWEVER, recognize that this isn't exactly a STEAL. You get what you pay for with this machine and don't expect any different.

This machine is the definition of getting the job done without going above and beyond. You can play just about any game/title but for some you will have to majorily sacrifice quality to get that performance you want.

I'll do a pros and cons list as to not loose you in an essay.

Pros:
Affordable
Performance as you'd expect
Tidy looking
Customizable
Necessary Software and hardware included
Wire management was nice
RAM is adequate for most users

Cons:
Graphics card (gpu) is mediocre at best
Cpu cooler and fan is abysmal!
Not a solid state Drive (ssd)
Upgrades to hardware recommended

Here I'd a list of what I would upgrade from most to least important:

Highly Recommended
Cpu cooler
Power supply (psu)
Graphics card (gpu)

Recommended
Hard drive to SSD
RAM

Not that Necessary
Processor
Extra Case fan

Since getting this computer, I have upgraded the gpu to a GTX 1050ti 4gb, a 650 gold modular PSU, and currently in process of getting new CPU Cooler (although I'd recommend upgrading that first thing because all the noise...comes from this and not to mention it just sucks and is inexpensive to replace)

Overall that is $285 of upgrades over 6 months which is very manageable for most I'd venture to say.

I was able to survive on the stock setup just fine, but naturally wanted to improve it and get some hands on experience with building a computer. My final build costs somewhere in the $700 range and is an absolute superstar and I'm very happy.

If you ever have any questions feel free to ask.

Good luck and enjoy this pc.

We purchased this gaming system for our son who has been recovering from an accident and has limited mobility.  He researched the gaming systems and chose this one.  It was relatively simple to set up and install.  Initially we had it connected via HDMI to his TV, but reverted back to using the monitor for better gaming experience.  It's a fairly portable system as well...we've moved it from one room to another with no connectivity issues.  We also purchased a wifi adapter so it would run off of his home connection. We also replaced the wired mouse with a lesser quality but more adaptable (he is one handed) wireless mouse.  The CPU itself is pretty cool with the red lights; it has ample USB ports for wireless adapters and such.  Overall, a very wise investment for the money.  It's very responsive and he enjoys it.

I gave this computer my best shot at working properly, but once again I'm stuck with a machine that won't start up. It worked fine for about a week, then the power supply went out. Completely dead. BTW, when it worked, I was happy with it and it ran games fine with sharp graphics. I emailed tech support, but I was able to buy an upgraded power supply on Amazon and replace it before they got back to me. Then they wanted me to return the dead power supply at my expense! Why? I had told them I already replaced it and I certainly had no intention of putting one of theirs back in. It worked fine for another two weeks and now it won't start up. The power supply works because the fans and LEDs lights in the case are on, but nothing else does. The keyboard, mouse and monitor, all of which have LEDs that light up when the computer is powered on, are dead. I give up. I should have returned it before I replaced the power supply. Live and learn I guess. I'll never buy this brand again and I would suggest you pass on it, too. They offer a free headset for reviews on Amazon, so beware of all the 5-star reviews here. The whole computer feels very cheaply made. It is a huge case with pretty much nothing in it. There is only one expansion slot, but I'm sure if you use it it will overload the cheap power supply anyway. You have to disassemble the computer to add another drive. Oh, the drive that came with it was installed crooked like the screws don't line up or something. The only good thing I can say about this computer is that it was cheap, but that's not saying much when it only worked for 3 weeks before dying.

Long story short I am very happy with this computer and at this moment and time I will plan on using the producers of this computer in the future.

EDIT: After using this PC after almost 2 years, I can say this PC is good if you are a beginning gamer. You can definitely build a better one for the same price and get more out of it. About 2 months after buying, it started force shutting down even without playing a game. And now the cpu cooler is failing out of nowhere. I would have wanted these parts to last longer than 2 years, but I guess it was false hope. If you want to play low end games that don't take a lot of cpu or require a lot for its graphics card, then you can buy this. After a few months, Ark can only be played on low settings with 30fps. Csgo lags severely only getting about 20 fps and 10 fps everytime I shoot. This graphics card is very old as well so newer games like Overwatch would just crash on the latest driver update. Most games played on this computer are only playable on everything low or medium for maximum fps (30-60). Minecraft gets about 70 fps. Streaming on this computer is a nightmare. You can only stream in 30 fps and very low quality and bit rate. I don't recommend streaming on this computer. Basically this computer is good for little kids who are just starting to get into PC gaming and are playing Roblox.

This pc is one of the best entry level gaming pc's for the price point.  It does everything you want it to do and boots up very quickly. First off, the shipping on this for me has been SUPER fast. Ordered this on Sunday and was expecting it to arrive on Friday; it shipped on Monday and arrived early Wednesday.

It's a great gaming computer for the price. It's a lightweight computer with room for improvement inside if you want to upgrade later down the road. I installed a bunch of games and they all ran smoothly; the graphics are great for this graphics card. I can see myself owning this computer for more than 4 years. I also love the keyboard and mouse, as well as the red light in the tower, not to mention that this computer runs pretty smoothly and I love doing my school work on it.

I don't like that the computer fan inside is loud, but I guess I can adapt to it since the tower is underneath my desk and not on top. The red light would be very distracting as well if it were on top of my desk. The keyboard light doesn't shut off ever, even when the computer is shut down completely so I have to either unplug the keyboard or the computer. I also don't like the opening on top of the computer because I just think a whole lot of dust can get inside the desktop a lot more easily, even though dust will find its way inside anyhow, but I just don't like the holes on top. That's just me. So a little more cleaning maintenance will be needed for this desktop.

All in all, I am pretty pleased with this desktop since it's my first desktop I picked out and purchased myself. I would recommend this desktop for beginner gamers or anyone who is looking for a fancy-looking computer with a red light. c:

Computer came defected. Waste of money. Has no SSD and has a crap graphics card (these are some of the most important things when looking for a gaming pc). For those of you that don't know, an SSD is way faster than HDD but its good to have SSD primarily to put windows and games on it (so they runs faster) and you can have HDD for everything else. League of Legends lagged on this computer and the only game it could run was Warcraft Frozen throne (which is super old and runs on minimum graphics). The computer constantly auto restarted saying that the pc had an issue (it wouldn't even diagnose the issue when we had the pc on). I factory reset the computer but it was still just the same. Don't waste your time with this product. Building a PC is way more worth it. Either that or look for a better computer (positive amazon reviews for computers are extremely unreliable as people usually don't know anything and just give five stars for essentially receiving their order in the mail). As many of the other negative reviews state, the company has TERRIBLE customer service so don't even bother. In conclusion, my 10 year old computer with windows vista performs better (even with games) than this and I haven't modified that computer in any way.

I guess my biggest beef with this was the wiring. I bought it knowing I would have to upgrade PSU and Graphics straight away so I bought the necessary parts along with it.

Who wires the PSU under the motherboard?! In order to replace the PSU I had to lift the motherboard, and remove the fan. I know this is not a big deal but at the same time it cost me extra time. Another thing is the wiring was done on the cheap no wiring covers or anything. The ties were on so tight it was pinching in some places.

On a positive note, I was under the impression that this had only a 350w PSU in it and mine had a 500w in it. Still not enough for my intended graphics card but a shocker non the less.

I kinda think this was designed with the intention of being placed to the right of the person using it, because of the placement of the usb slots on the front left, and the way the door covering the power button and dvd tray, hinges open to the right. But I have it to my left and it's not really a problem.

You get what you pay for, and this PC is just okay.  Most of the parts in here are really cheap.  I've had it for less than a year, and already the letter markings are fading from the keyboard and the magnets have fallen out of the mouse.  Sometimes the fan starts making clanking noises when it turns on.  If you want to upgrade the graphics card to play the latest games, you will also need to upgrade the power source to something with more power.  Overall, I'm not confident that this computer will last.  The plus side to this computer is that it is a working computer with a good enough CPU, motherboard, hard drive, and computer shell.

After reading through all the reviews I decided to pick up this computer because I was to nervous to build my own.  I thought I struck gold with this deal everyone said it could run new games and that it was a great starter PC that could be easily upgraded.  Yea okay on what planet?  This computer is garbage.  I was using a 4 year old laptop that could get 50 fps on dota2 this one would get 30 fps in low detail just barely, it also crashed a few times.  After realizing what a terrible mistake I made I researched how to build my own compupter, I watched a bunch of youtube videos, used pcpartpicker and reddit (r/buildapc) and built my own computer that blows the socks of this piece of junk.  If you are wondering why this computer has so many great reviews it is probably due to the fact that they send you a card that says "leave us a review for a free gaming headset".  Do yourselves a favor and do some research and build your own computer, you will be much happier with the results.

P.S:  I love how they offer a bundle deal with 144hz monitor, like this piece of junk would even make use or a 144hz monitor.

For the price I paid, this product rounds all of the bases. I am a gamer, admittedly primarily on console these days; however, this PC has been able to handle everything I've thrown at it so far. Yes, it might not be neck and neck with a $900+ unit, but unless you're running algorithms attempting to predict the next coming of the Daleks, or are holding a magnifying glass to your screen (both of which I would suggest to be fool's errands) than this computer will likely get you where you want to be, or at least close, without breaking the bank.

The video card, hard drive, ram, processor and # of cores for $500 is a no brainer when comparing to a business computer, "consumer" PC, or most definitely a Mac. This thing is fast! I had no troubles installing a firewire PCI-E card (tip: You need to unscrew the "lip" on the side to allow the card's bracket to fit for a smooth installation... it had been years since installing one and it took me over an hour till the lightbulb popped.) The firewire is for an RME Fireface 400 interface for a pro audio rig. And it runs Pro Tools just fine.

I had no troubles with Windows 10 and downloading drivers for my gear that was previously hooked up to a Mac.

Games such as Civilization 5 would freeze my early 2011 MacBook Pro with an Intel HD 3000 video card. And WoW Legion requires beefier specs, making the game unplayable on the Mac. With this computer, loading times are so much faster and the graphics quality was nothing short of amazing in comparison... I didn't know what I was missing!

And the Corsair Mechanical Keyboard (Strafe) is programmable (and awesome!) now that I can finally utilize the software that only works with PC's.

The only con is the fan is a little loud, but that's to be expected with more power. But it never shuts off! A little annoying but... c'mon. Also, the red glow is less obtrusive than expected, so that's good.

It's still new, so I will update if anything goes wrong. So far, so good!

EDIT: The cooling fan was a joke and died within a month. That's why it was so loud. Scared me when the comp kept shutting down by itself. Turns out the fan died and it was overheating. Replaced with a much larger Cooler Master fan. All is well (and quiet!). Dropped to 4*'s to reflect this. Otherwise it's been a good computer.

Introduction | CyberpowerPC Gamer Ultra GUA3100A Gaming Desktop is a good starter PC with nice choice components for the price. I purchased this PC after the amazing Amazon.com July 12th Prime Day Special which had it discounted to $400 instead of the base price of $500, but I got it at a somewhat similar deal through other promotional means via Amazon.com.

For around the similar price I paid, I am actually shocked at how well it handles the games i've thrown at it so far. the CPU and GPU are not to be underestimated, which I originally did. It runs my 2010, 2011 and 2012 games on medium to high custom settings without much trouble. all at full 1080p HD mind you.

Details | This is not a true elite tier / Enthusiast level PC, it's entry level for sure but I think CyberPowerPC knows this because in the case there is A LOT of extra space for you as the customer to do later on, from my personal experience, there is enough extra room for a bigger and better GPU, at least 2 more 120ml fans (I think? 1 more 120ml fan for sure at the top of the tower) and it has a 3rd USB option near the front on the left side of the rig, which means a possibility for an extra USB 2.0 slot or even a single 3.0 slot for those lightning fast speeds.

UPDATE: I just realize the tower has indeed 2 case fans instead of one, one in the back which is a 120 and one at the bottom front near the stylish front with crimson red. I didn't notice this at first because the summer heat made me assume there wasn't more than 1 case included fan activated but there is indeed! I plan on adding at least 2 more 140ml fans to this rig later on. if it's possible.

Also I forgot to mention, the included bundle gaming keyboard and mouse bundle far excels that of a basic keyboard and mouse bundle, such as ones offered by Logitech and the Amazon Basics keyboard, I compared it to general use and budget gaming keyboards and mice such as Tecknet and in my opinion the quality is for good!

What impresses me greatly of this CyberPowerPC brand Gaming PC is the elite level LOOK of the items you get. for $500 ($400 or slightly lower when special on sale promotions happen like Prime Day and Black Friday/Cyber Monday) there are towers from Dell, HP and Lenova with only Intel HD graphics available that look aesthetically basic with no flashy rave party LED lights installed. I don't know how CyberPowerPC does it but they completely outmatch the likes of HP, Dell and Lenova in this regard.

I do not know how customer support is yet as this is my first ever CyberPowerPC purchase, but from my interactions on the official facebook page of CyberPowerPC, they seem to care. I'll update this in the future if i ever have a need to contact them for other things. I took care of a couple of problems I ran into myself during set up and installation but it was simple enough for even a novice like me to over come.

I'm a fan of Black and Purple not Black and Red so over time I plan on modding the system to glow Neon Purple instead of Red.

Overall on average my frames per second at full1080p HD resolution on 2010, 2011 and 2012 games is roughly 45 to 50 frames per second on average, in some cases even full 60 frames per second, it's very impressive because I was not expecting this level of good performance because I did research before purchase and the GPU known as the Radeon R7 240 2GB is not nearly as powerful as my main rig's GPU set up which is a Gigabyte Radeon HD 7870 x2 running on x6 Triple Turbulence Force fans, my current set up is much more beastly than this for certain but I paid a lot of money for those powerful video cards back in late 2012/early 2013, and there is two of them as opposed to one so that's also an unfair match up. The CPU is actually pretty good as well for the total value, although I don't know much about AMD CPU's to be honest, i've always used Intel CPUs until now, so far it's good though, not many slow downs in CPU hungry apps and games.

Bonus Features | Since my promotional bonuses and my boss paying me a handsome amount for my extra services, I bought the bundle edition which came with a AOC Full HD 1080p Monitor with 1ms, 144Hz and AMD Free Sync along with some other technical details. The Monitor is beautiful, it's my first ever owned 1080p monitor with a very fast refresh rate, 1ms is the fastest you can get I heard. I'm overall very impressed!

Conclusion | I plan on updating this review over time because this is a very big deal to me. But so far CyberPowerPC is truly a leader in the industry that I plan on relying on from here on out for my gaming PC needs. The only reason it is 4 stars instead of a perfect 5 stars for me is because if things fall perfectly into place, I plan on sellling this gaming rig to either family or a room mate/friend of mine who needs it more than me. One year update: lowered my star rating to a two. Originally was pleased on week one with this purchase. But....the PC quit prior to one year of use. And far from heavy use. Here is what I went through with this company to try and get a part.

Three weeks shy of this PC being a year old, it would not stay powered on. Emailed them on July 14th. No response. Called tech support later that day, they never picked up. After 30 minutes, I hung up.

Then I  had to wait through the weekend. Started calling on Monday, July 17th....again. Got someone named Ryan who diagnosed it as an interior cooling fan. He asked the purchase date, which was already passed a year.....BUT.....I ordered it on Prime Day and it was backordered, so I did not actually get it in my hands until weeks after that in August 8th.  So he had to "check into it" to see if they were actually going to cover it. Then I had to email proof of those dates which I did immediately, and he was supposed to get back to me. He didnt. I had to email him....again...for a status update on July 18th. He  advised that they would cover it (As a final compensation, he says) because the one year anniversary of delivery had not passed yet.

I emailed back on July 18th, and asked when the part might be shipped. No response... at all. Even up until today, July 25th.

So today, I had to take more time out of my day to call them. Got customer service. She asked for my RMA number. Oh....yeah? Well, I don't have one of those, was never provided one. Gave my info, and on hold I go. Ten minutes later, she comes back. Advises me that "she doesn't know what the problem is", but the part should ship out soon. Ok....when? "Soon." Okay, I can't work with soon. She says, okay, by the end of this week. Really? Did that just pop up in your screen just now? "No, but it will ship by the end of the week." Why has it not been shipped already? "I don't know, backordered maybe?"

Maybe??

Okay, what method of shipment? "UPS ground."  (The slowest method of any carrier!) So that will take another week, plus all of this current week. Plus all the time they have already taken because "they don't know what the problem is"  with the replacement part.

Miracle of miracles! This afternoon, I got am email that the part was shipped! How did that happen? No one knew where it was or why it had not been shipped but as if by magic, there it was! And it's not even the end of the week! Amazing!

One small problem! During my convo with tech support on the17th, I advised him that I had moved to another state. When I was sending him the supporting documents, I realized that he NEVER asked for the new address. So in my email, so reminded him and put the new address in big, bold letters.

He acknowledged receiving those documents with said new address. One would assume that he would have changed it on my account.

Nope. Didn't happen.

So, the part is due to arrive on July 31st, in a place that I no longer live because they sent it to the WRONG address.

This is all blatant incompetence and totally unacceptable.

The PC has been out of commission since July 14th. And at this point, it will be down for an extended period of time.

I would not recommend this PC to anyone. Fans should not break in less then a year.  But Cyberpowers customer service and technical support is way below expected standards. They warranty them for a year but if this is what you need to go through to get them fixed, they are not worth squat.

Years ago, I owned a Dell. They had parts there in just a few days. Can't help but wonder if Cyberpower ever heard of Priority Mail?

Needless to say, I will never do business with this company again. Period.

And those questions occur, "Will it work?", "Will I have to purchase something extra?" "Will it be too complicated to set up?" The product came promptly after I'd ordered it late on a Saturday.  It took a couple of business days to arrive.  The set up was super easy.  Practically read over the instructions and everything was ready to go out of the box.  My top 2 PC games right now are Marvel Heroes 2016 and XCOM 2.  The graphics for both games are pretty intense so lag is always an issue.  After downloading both games, I literally sat back in amazement.  NO LAG!!! It was a completely new experience after playing Marvel Heroes for over a year!! This is the first time my game NEVER LAGGED! This product came with Windows 10 and I transferred my McAfee sub right over, no problem.  There's no wifi connectivity but I plugged my Ethernet cable right it which I recommend for gaming anyway.  This was well worth it! AWESOME product!!!

Out of the box Windows 10 already loaded  which made it nice, but it does not come with a ethernet cable so order one up! This is not wireless. The mouse and keyboard are a nice addition since they match, This made my son very happy. He has been playing Steam on this for hours and has not once complained that it is slow.(like when on my computer). It has made gaming fun again! We needed a second computer for homework and this will be great for that as well! I think the price is spot on for a gaming teenagers first computer.

I built my own based off this model through the third party company "G-Systems" and it is a powerful machine! We got it to overclock at 4.2 ghz, maxed out the RAM at 16 gigabytes, upgraded to a large premium white and black case with blue LED's, changed the graphics card to the Nvidia GTX970 Asus version and upgraded the power supply. I highly recommend G-Systems, because we exchanged emails for months building the PC and while waiting for my house to sell. Excellent customer service at all times. They were quick to get back to all of my emails and always with a friendly attitude. They included free games and tested everything and upgraded several things for free (Windows 10 professional, WiFi adapter, power supply, mail was slow due to recent weather so they upgraded me to two day shipping for free) to make sure it was a quality unit before sending it out. The stock version of this PC has a bad power supply I have seen on YouTube, but G-Systems automatically replaces that. Each upgrade came with a great price as well. I can play Metal Gear Solid: Phantom Pains, Fallout 4, Ryse: Son of Rome, and Just Cause 3 (plays without any glitches) on the highest settings without any lag. My price increased with upgrading of course, but it was worth every penny to have a powerful computer.

I unplug the computer to move it onto a new table and now the HDMI doesn't work anymore and my CPU fan also doesn't work. I should've checked to see what the warranty, or if there was even one, said because this should've lasted me longer than only six months. Initially when I first began to research various gaming desktops, I was a little put off by some of the reviews on here. I've had this computer for about a week and overall I am quite pleased with it. I use it to run The Elder Scrolls Online on medium-high settings with no problem. My only problems that I have are that the computer itself runs quite a bit louder than I expected, however it isn't very noticeable when I'm playing a game with headphones on. However, the cpu fan in mine also makes a VERY noticeable and sometimes even quite loud buzzing noise, but I plan to fix this by simply replacing the fan itself, which is a faster and cheaper solution than replacing the whole computer because of it.

Other than that I don't believe I have any complaints, however be warned that this computer does not come with built in wireless capability, meaning that you will either have to plug an Ethernet cord into it like I did, or buy a usb wireless adapter. If you prefer to use an Ethernet cord but you don't want to run a cord through your entire house, I highly suggest that you look into Pluglink Ethernet, I don't think very many people know about it but it is extremely simple and easy to use and it eliminates the need to run a cord between your computer and your router/modem.

So all in all this is a great computer for the price, however don't expect it to be some kind of gaming supercomputer. Yes, it is rather powerful, but if you can afford it then I would definitely suggest putting a better graphics card in it, as the one that comes with the computer isn't the greatest.

This is a great PC for everyday work.  It runs applications quickly, smoothly, and reliably.  Don't even think about buying a so-called productivity PC from HP or Dell, they are slow and overpriced and they lack the basic power to run clunky Windows smoothly.

The motherboard is not the fastest gaming option, but it does have six built in SATA channels and between the case and the board, 6 USB ports.  The Gigabyte BIOS interface (press DEL at the splash screen) is very easy to control and overclock.  The case is really nice with very easy to remove side panels and a nice and large, clear window.  I'm not a big fan of the power button inside the front door, but no biggie.  The air inlets on the front, side, and back are elevated off the floor, so the case can sit on a rug no problem.  I was pleasantly surprised to find a 600W PSU inside.  There are two USB ports and headphone/mic ports on the left side of the front panel.  There are open open 3.5" and 2.5" drive bays that are easy to access, plus two 5.25 bays that are front facing, under the included DVD-RW.  Very nice mouse feel, and the keyboard is better than most stock keyboards and has programmable macro keys.

I replaced the small noisy CPU fan with a Zalman CNPS8900 Quiet cooler and added a second 120 mm case fan in the top position.  I am running CPU at 4.2/4.4 GHz/Turbo and it runs cool and stable with a top recorded gaming temp of 43C at 4.2/4.4GHz and 39C at the stock speed of 3.8/4.0 Ghz.
The weakest point is probably the AMD Radeon r7 240.  The graphics performance is only adequate for basic gaming, with about 300 fps in a Minecraft window with medium rendering quality settings, that drops to 130 fps full screen at 1920 x 1080.  For comparison, my i7/4.0Ghz with an Nvidia Titan does 900-1100 fps with the same game settings.

Overall this PC is a great buy that will run household tasks exceptionally smooth, and provide a good entry level gaming experience.

I bought this after a failed attempt to build my own. Mine came with a Gigabyte 78LMT-SP2 motherboard, upgradable to 16gb RAM. Case build is as decent as case materials get. With stock components it ran The Forest on high with zero lag. I had parts from my failed build so now I replaced the stock 500W PSU with a 750W modular, Kingston fury 8gb x2, and an evga 960.
Doom 2016 runs 70 FPS on ultra with no problems. Would recommend additional fans as the stock airflow is weak.

Overall, if you need an entry level to get the job done this is it. If you have even slight mechanical skill you can easily bump the GPU PSU and RAM for a beast machine for pennies compared to competitors. CPU isn't everything, these days it's all about your GPU, but I'm still matching/surpassing my friend's ibuypower with an Intel i7 and 980ti. Highly recommend this rig

The whole thing feels cheap. I've had to replace basically everything they sent me for more quality stuff. I should have done my homework and bought parts separately but I was a scrub and bought this cheap thing. I like the case, but beyond that the power supply was a no-name company, and within 1 month the CPU fan had begun to hum. When I contacted the company for support they told me I'd have to send them the original part before they would send me another. Essentially, this company is selling over-hyped parts with cool cases. I am convinced most of the these 5 star reviews were bought and paid for.

Careful when purchasing this tower. The power supply that came with it had stripped cords and sparked nearly causing a fire. Switched it out because didn't have time to send back and or wait for a response. Keyboard and mouse don't work at all either. After replacing the power supply it runs great.

This computer is pretty powerful. it will run minecraft, with everything to the max, at 30-ish fps. all that while downloading steam games. CSGO is a cinch, as is KSP and Gmod, both on max or just below. The only game that it had some trouble with was "Stranded Deep" which is pretty graphic intensive in and of itself, but after toying around with the resolution and graphics details it ran like a dream. This computer will run Gmod stretched onto two monitors with very little, if any, trouble. I've had it for only three days yet still haven't played any games without a background download going, but it's definitely a good buy in my opinion. The keyboard and mouse that come with it work best. I have a alienware keyboard I picked up at a Goodwill store but i don't use it with this because i like the CyberPowerPC one better. The mouse is uber comfortable and it's enjoyable to use, whether I'm surfing the web, shooting baddies or launching a spaceship.

I tried gta 5 on this and it wouldn't run smoothly unless I set the resolution to a little box in the middle of my monitor (800x600). I was happy to have Windows 10 installed but it did not come with an activation code to activate the windows on the PC. If I am emailed and these problems (any of them) are solved, I will update my review. Don't recommend this as a Starter PC, you can easily buy a way better PC by building it yourself, which is what I should have done. Thank you for reading this review!

Giving this a 3 star only because I like the hardware it comes with. Straight out of the box the speakers would not play except through HDMI (and no they would not turn off through settings). Video card software and drivers caused huge instability issues. Also loud noise from the hard drive.
I reset to factory out of the box settings and did NOT install the AMD video card software drivers. This fixed the instability issues, I then installed another screw to secure the hard drive which fixed the noise problem.
It's also misleading to claim that this unit has 7.1 surround sound when it clearly does not!

(Update 12/20/16) Changing this to 4 stars, would be 5 stars if I had not had original issues. After I fixed these issues above I have had a great experience with this unit. We keep this on 24/7 and use it for everything.

(Update 4/8/17) Changing back to 3 stars since the CPU cooler just went out. Also the case cooling fan has started making noise as well, hopefully just some loose screws.

In theory, this is a "nice gaming machine", but in reality, it simply makes no sense.

The R7 240 GPU is pointless, it has no reason to exist.  They might as well take the money from that and put an APU in, it'll be faster.  Heck, even Intel graphics are faster these days than that card is (HD 530 on a Skylake chip).

For less than $50 more (less than 10%), a real gaming GPU such as a R7 360 could be included that is up to three times as fast.

Sure, I suppose that if you play World of Tanks and League of Legends only and never want to do more, it'll work.  But so will anything modern.

The CPU is fine for this price point, but it is deceptive.  A i3-6100 would crush this CPU in overall performance and includes better graphics.  Replacing this CPU/GPU with a H110 motherboard and i3-6100 would be a similar price point, and be faster in basically every use case (and consume half the electricity).  But it doesn't sound as impressive on a spec sheet which is why they don't do it.

It was delivered on time but, the box the computer was in was crushed on the corner but, inspected it didn't show any damage to the case. It came with Windows 10 installed but not activated and no product key to activate it. I called their tech support and got a message to leave my number and they would call me back, that was 5 days ago so I am thinking if their tech support is that busy then they have problems with their computers and may be a good idea to avoid them. While I was unpacking it I noticed the processor was installed completely it was laying in it's slot at a 45 degree angle. All in all if I had it all to do over or if I could return this thing I would.

I tried calling up customer service, I got some voicemail telling me to leave my number and that's it. It's been a week now and these people still haven't called me back.

The PC itself is alright, except for the fact that it doesn't come with it's own WiFi card. You'll have to buy your own separate WiFi card (or a WiFi USB card) in order for this computer to get internet access without an Ethernet cable.

The graphics card it comes with it also fairly rudimentary. You'll be able to play modern games on it, but for some of them you'll have to put it at a low settings and reduced resolution.

Overall the service i've received with this product has been frustrating. Even moreso because I ordered the damn four-year warranty like a fool.

Before purchasing this desktop computer I used to play games on my laptop. Smite, XCOM, Gmod, etc. Everything ran like hot trash on that old laptop. When I got my computer about 2 weeks ago I started playing all my games while sitting at my desk. Everything runs so smooth and I can run most of my games at high settings. For multiplayer games I now play much better because I'm not dealing with poor graphics or visual stutters.

I would highly recommend this computer if you don't have too much money. For me that was a huge thing when I was making the purchase. "Is this worth the money?" I definitely say yes. After doing the research and then experiencing the computer for myself, I can honestly say that for the price you get an amazing value.

There are a couple things I don't really like about it though. Mainly just the case lights. I haven't taken apart a computer in so long that I don't want to open it up to disable the case lights. They aren't too bright, but in the middle of the night it sometimes is hard to sleep with the red light in the corner of the room. This is a minor gripe, as the computer runs amazingly and I doubt that the case lights actually effect the computer at all. I find I have the same problem with the keyboard and mouse the computer comes with, but I just cover them with a t shirt when I go to sleep, so it's not too bad. Otherwise there is nothing I can see that is a defect or is something I dislike about the computer.

I am thinking about getting a new keyboard and mouse in the future that do not have lights on them, but as of now the lights on them are easily combated in the dark.

This might be the best computer I have had in a LONG time. When I used PC I was getting 60 fps and up to 120 fps if i turned frame limiting off (on the games I could turn it off).  With 2 GB of VRAM and a 3.8 GHZ Quad-Core CPU and then the price on top of that, its almost perfect, HOWEVER if you intend on running games at higher than 4K then i do recommend you do upgrade the GPU to something around 4-8 GB (I recommend a NVidia card over AMD but each as there own) .  If you plan on using this for emulation  its almost perfect too, it can handle most emulators, the only one I have ever had trouble with  Xenia (Xbox 360 emulator that is in early beta) which is to be expected with a beta program. The CPU fan... it hasn't broken on me YET, a friend of mine purchased this last month and the CPU fan died about 2 weeks after they purchased it, but as they are not overly expensive he just threw 40$ at his PC and got a new one, that is really the only con i found, but other than that its more than worth the price and I recommend this to almost anyone who is looking for a low priced PC, and still good specs

This is the second system I bought for me, after getting one for my wife.
I still appreciate the very clean system, sans bloatware. The second one I bought however had a serious power issue, or possibly a bad mobo (motherboard, a.k.a. logic board). It failed to respond at all to pressing the main power button. About the time I was completing my service request call, it came on by itself. Later after powering it down, it would not restart. Literally, hours later, it came on again, by itself. While going through every cable and tracing the power supply noticed a label on the back stating, "Assembled from tested components. Complete system not tested." I suppose that is partly why it's priced low, but certainly a disappointment to be the first to power it on and discover it didn't work. Now I have to deal with shipping it back and not having a computer while I wait. I'll update this review depending on the quality and speed of this process. So far, the customer service from CyberpowerPC has been very good.

Because of this second experience I have downgraded my rating from 5 to 3.

Below is the feedback on the first system I bought for my wife.
Setup was a snap. The PC looks great and so far has been perfect. My favorite part... Zero bloatware. I was stunned actually how clean the hard drive was. Makes getting started way faster because now I don't have to uninstall a bunch of garbage.

UPDATE: 4/29/16 - reduced to 1 star.
This has been one of those total fail scenarios. The returned PC came back to me a couple weeks later, WITH THE EXACT SAME PROBLEM. Now, I'm in the process of having a new power supply sent (still waiting). This has all taken so long that now I can't just return it to Amazon and buy something else, from a different vendor.

Bottom line: You may or may not get a working PC when you buy from CyberpowerPC. :(

First, let me start by saying I'm a 52 year old man and this is my first "gaming computer."  Also, yes, I knew before ordering it had red lights.

I've played computer games since the late 80's on my Apple IIGS and have always been happy with what would be considered a "normal" household computer or laptop.  I didn't need much in the way of processor speed or a hyped-up graphic card.  Only recently I started playing online battle games (World of Warships) and decided I wanted to experience the visual graphics the way they were meant to be seen.

First the good.  The price was great for what you receive.  Yes, I know it's an entry level machine but it seems to work very well for what I do online.  My son (24) who plays online said I needed at least a 2 GB video card and 6-8 Gigs of RAM.  This comes with that and a nice big hard drive for storage.  The computer comes preloaded with Windows 10 which works well.  It's a great day-to-day household computer as well as a gaming computer when you want to have some fun.

Now the bad (for me anyway...).  Did I mention I'm 52? Yes, I did.  The glowing red lights and jazzed up keyboards might be great if I was 18, but at 52 I can live without it.  Note to computer companies, yes, older guys (and gals) play computer games and don't need a glowing nuclear reactor in their living room to have fun!  I was amazed how difficult it was to find any gaming computer (less than $700) that didn't have the glowing bells & whistles.  There are none...  Another problem I have regarding the lights is that they (and the cooling fans) DO NOT shut off when you put the computer to sleep!  I contacted CyberpowerPC about this and they said that since they (lights/fans) receive their power directly from the power supply they stay on (for your viewing enjoyment) ALL THE TIME.  Again, I don't need a glowing reactor in my living room so I find that I shut down my computer more often than I used to with my old HP and have to wait for it to boot up once again when I want to do some work/play.

A few other minor things.  It's louder than my old HP desktop.  More fans = more noise.  Again, if the fans would shut off when I put it to sleep that wouldn't be an issue, but even when it's "sleeping" it makes fan noise and glows.  Did I mention it glows? Yes, it does.

The keyboard with it's red highlights, (I see a theme here...) works fine but I feel the keys are slightly harder to push down than other keyboards I've used in the past.  I didn't hook up the wired mouse since I went with my old wireless mouse instead.  Again, maybe some 18 year old wants all those buttons but I tend to want to keep it simple.

NOTE: When ordering I requested that it be shipped in an "Amazon" box so that folks wouldn't know what it was.  The computer box was placed inside a much larger box with minimal packaging.  I experienced no damage to my computer's box but it made it VERY awkward to handle which probably slowed down my delivery time.  Come on Amazon/CyberpowerPC, get some better boxes!

In closing, I like this purchase.  The computer works well and I'm having much more fun with my online gaming.  For a few hundred dollars more than an average household computer I'm experiencing the world of online gaming the way it should and can be.  I wouldn't have any problems giving it five stars if it came without lights OR the lights and fan shut off when you put it to sleep.

Happy gaming!

1/11/2016 I upgrade my graphics card to GTX 960 and my power supply to support that card. Everything runs so beautifully with the updgrade, granted the motherboard is tiny compared to the card, but it runs fine, I have literally no issue of overheating. I need to get around to some cable management to get the side of the chassis back on, but other than that it runs like a true champion. I saved a ton of money getting this on sale when it was, along with the graphics card and power supply. It can run and support a lot of games out there right now but either on the recommended or low quality side. Still a great start pc, but I needed something on the fly and essentially only needed to upgrade two items, and it worked out for me and hope it will for others.

I received the package 10/15/15. It arrived at my house with the box torn open and pretty badly beaten up. The pc itself was fine started up fine and everything; After an hour of use the wifi adapter stopped working and the hdmi port stopped working ;(

I was super excited to get this computer, but the headline says it all. First off, I had planned to replace the power supply off the bat, when I opened the case, the wires were arranged decently, and I decided to try and power it on before doing anything. Nothing. Tried again, nothing. First issue came when I found out the tiny plug that connects the power button to the mother board had been disconnected. When I reattached it, it was EXTREMLY lose and came off just from shifting the tower. (Come to find out from a customer service rep later, that is normal apparently.) Fixed that, turned it, and yay, lights are on, but it dosent boot. Called tech suppourt, and after an hour of unplugging this, and replacing that, we decide that the mother board is dead and that's all there is to it. I'm disappointed because this PC is very large, and had TONS of room.to add improvements inside, but now I have to ship it back, and wait 5-7 days for it to arrive just to get my refund to buy a new computer. Customer service through the seller and the actual maker was excellent, but I am very dissatisfied that not only do I have a broken PC, but I have to wait a week PLUS the time to buy and ship another one just to have a computer.
Overall build is nice as well, I will give it that, but the included mouse and keyboard  are horrid, they feel like junk that you could buy at a dollar store, and the coards are flimsy enough that I'd expect them to break within a month.

Final Thoughts:
Build quality : 3/5
Packaging: 5/5
Accuracy to online ad: 5/5
Usability: 0/5
